titleStmt.title: Maṣḥafa ʾardǝʾǝt / Maṣḥafa gǝnzat / Maṣḥafa krǝstǝnnā

publicationStmt.publisher: Die Schriftkultur des christlichen Äthiopiens: Eine multimediale Forschungsumgebung / beta maṣāḥǝft

licence.p: This file is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0.

supportDesc.extent:
Made of 97.0 folios, of which blank 1r-v, 2r-v, 73v, in 14.0 quires (13+A).
130 130 50
supportDesc.foliation: The folia are numbered by the Ethio-SPaRe project, the guard leaves are numbered through. Foliation mistake: the f. following f. 56 was left unnumbered and it has got number 56a. The last folio is numbered 96.

binding.decoNote: Two wooden boards covered with brown tooled leather (quarter cover). Three sewing stations.
Two pairs of chains of endband stitches at the spine cover.
Blind tooled ornament on the brown leather cover (at least 2 tools were used: Double circle, double line fillet).

origin.origDate: 17th century for the second codicological unit.

bibl.title: Churches and Monasteries of Tǝgray. A Survey of Manuscript Collections
Supplement to Aethiopica

msItem.title: መጽሐፈ፡ አርድእት፡
msItem.colophon: ዘጸሐፋ፡ ንዋይ፡ ማርያም፡ ኃጥ[ዕ]፡ ወዘአጽሐፋ፡ ፍ[ስ]ሐ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ … The colophon mentions the name of the scribe and the commissioner

layout.ab: The upper line is written above the ruling.
The bottom line is written above the ruling.

handDesc.handNote:
18th or 19th century crude, irregular hand. Irregular small letters of smaller size, thick strokes, weak shadings, half-opened rings Black, red (luminous vivid red) The scribe is mentioned in the colophon. ff. 1-12
ይ፡ ካ፡ for ይበል፡ ካሕን፡ (e.g., f. 10rb)
ይ፡ ዲ፡ for ይበል፡ ዲያቆን፡ (e.g., ff. 10rb, 12ra)
ይ፡ ሕ፡ for ይበል፡ ሕዝብ፡ (f. 10rb)

decoDesc.decoNote: Nomina sacra; a few lines in the incipit pages of Texts I and II, alternating with black lines; two initial lines of each sections of Texts I and II; elements of the punctuation signs; Ethiopic numerals or their elements; some other words, e.g., ʾǝgale (e.g., ff. 8ra, 12va).

origin.origDate: Can be dated palaeographically to the 18th or 19th century.

msItem.title: መጽሐፈ፡ ግንዘት
Funeral procession (readings for the “stations”)
Readings and prayers for the 1st station
Readings and prayers for the 2nd station
Readings and prayers for the “greeting of tābot” by the deceased
Readings and prayers for the funeral of deacons
ድርሳን፡ በእንተ፡ እለ፡ ኖሙ፡ ካህናት፡ ወዲያቆናት፡
Story of release of an impure rich man from the Hell
Discourse about the necessity of remembrance feast (tazkār)
Prayer of Matthew the Apostle over deceased men and women
Absolution and prayers
Homily on the Deceased
Readings and prayers over deceased children
Readings and prayers over deceased adult women
Readings and prayers over deceased young girls
Readings for the 3rd day after burial
Readings for the 7th day after burial
Readings for the 3th, 40th day after burial and for each tazkār
Supplications and prayers over deceased priests
Readings over the holy water
Prayer over deceased monks
Blessing for the “community of the saints”
Blessing
መጽሐፈ፡ ክርስትና፡

rubric.title: Introduction, prayer of thanksgiving and incense
Absolution of the mother and prayer of incense
Prayer over those to be baptised
Anointing
rubric.note: The order of annointing corresponds more closely to that of .

rubric.title: After anointing, the priest speaks a prayer of thanksgiving, bends the knees of those to be baptised and says another prayer
Prayer for those who gave their names for baptism
Those to be baptised put off their clothes and reject Satan
First prayer after Confession of faith
Anointing of shoulders, breast, stomach, hands, knees, members
Silent prayer at the baptismal font
rubric.note: As in , this prayer is followed by the prayers of thanksgiving and incense.

rubric.title: Titus 2,11-3,8
rubric.note: The biblical texts are fully quoted in this manuscript.

rubric.title: 1 John 5,5-13
rubric.note: The biblical texts are fully quoted in this manuscript.

rubric.title: Acts 8,26-40
rubric.note: A prayer is mentioned between the readings of 1 John and Acts 8.
The biblical texts are fully quoted in this manuscript.

rubric.title: Prayers for the sick, the travelling, the faith, the fruit of the earth, the water of rivers, the king, the new Christians, for those who give alms, for the deceased
rubric.note: The prayers are not fully quoted.

rubric.title: Prayer over those to be baptised
Prayer after the Sanctus
rubric.note: This prayer is divided here into two prayers.

rubric.title: Confession of Faith, Our Father and Absolution of the son
Crossing and prayers before the baptism
Prayer taking place before the church.
Anointing of the eyelids and eyes
Anointing of the nose and mouth
Anointing of the knees, feet, shoulder and breast
Prayer of Blessing while imposing the hands
Those who were anointed are dressed in white clothes
Prayer for the worthiness of those who have been baptised
Prayer for the growth of wisdom and supplications to Mary and Saints

msItem.colophon: ff. 96rb-96va ተተርጐመት፡ ዛቲ፡ መጽሐፍ፡ በልሳነ፡ ቅብጢ፡ ወዓረቢ፡ ኀበ፡ ነገረ፡ ግዕዝ፡ ስረዩ፡ ወባርኩኒ፡ ለጸሐፊሐ፡ ኀጥእ፡ ወአባሲ፡ በአንብሮ፡ ቆብዕ፡ ዘእመስል፡ ፈላሲ፤ ወልብየሰ፡ ምሉዓ፡ ጹግ፡ ከይሲ፡ ከመ፡ ይደምስስ፡ አበሳየ፡ ወአበሳክሙ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ እምነግህ፡ እስከ፡ ይመሲ፡፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፡፡ ወአሜን፡፡ Embedded colophon on the translation from Coptic and Arabic.

layout.ab: The upper line is written above the ruling.
The bottom line is written above the ruling.

handNote.seg: 17th century careful hand. Broad, upright and round letter shapes

list.item: ይ፡ ካ፡ for ይበል፡ ካሕን፡ (e.g., f. 76ra, 77ra)
ይ፡ ዲ፡ for ይበል፡ ዲያቆን፡ (e.g., f. 75rb)
እስመ፡/ እስመ፡ ለ/ለዓለም፡ for እስመ፡ ለዓለም፡ ምሕረቱ፡ (e.g., ff. 65rb, 65vb, 66ra)

decoDesc.decoNote: Nomina sacra; names of Hebrew letters in Ps. 118 (e.g., fols. 14rb); elements of the punctuation signs; Ethiopic numerals or their elements; some other words, e.g., ʾǝgale (e.g., f. 25vb), halle (ff. 14va), ṣalot (e.g., ff. 15vb, 16rb, 18rb), qǝdma wangel (e.g., ff. 24vb, 55rb, 57ra), halle luyā (ff. 51vb, 54va, 56ava), wa-tǝbl (e.g., ff. 56ra, 60ra, 93rb), salām (f. 67ra), wa-ʾǝmzǝ (e.g., ff. 78va, 80vb, 92vb).
Spaces between asterisks filed with thin horizontal lines in black and red, ff. 24ra, 24vb, 25va, 26ra, 26vb, 54rb, 59rb, 83ra.
Thin horizontal lines splitting a single word: ff. 38ra, 53rb, 74va.

item.desc: Immediate correction marked by thin lines below or above the word.

origin.origDate: Can be dated palaeographically to the 17th century.
